meanings.definition: A story, poem, or picture that can be interpreted to reveal a hidden meaning, typically a moral or political one.
meanings.sent1: The teacher read an allegory to the class to teach them a lesson about honesty.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient fables are allegories that convey important life lessons.
meanings.sent3: The allegory about the talking animals made the children giggle in class.
meanings.sent4: In the allegory of the cave, Plato explores the concept of enlightenment.
meanings.sent5: The allegory of the tortoise and the hare teaches us the value of perseverance.

meanings.definition: The expression by means of symbolic fictional figures and actions of truths or generalizations about human existence.
meanings.sent1: The author used allegories in his novel to represent different aspects of society.
meanings.sent2: Literary critics often analyze allegories to uncover deeper meanings in texts.
meanings.sent3: The allegory of the two trees arguing over sunlight was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The allegory of the ship lost at sea symbolizes the struggle of life's uncertainties.
meanings.sent5: The allegory of the broken mirror reflects the fragility of human relationships.
